intro: Matricaria chamomilla subsp. courrantiana, commonly known as the Narrow-leaved Chamomile, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, linear leaves and small, yellow flower heads that resemble chamomile. The plant produces white-petaled flowers that develop into dark褐色 seed heads, which are used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun, often found in dry meadows and grasslands. Its chemical composition includes essential oils with compounds like chamazulene, known for their anti-inflammatory properties.
